sentences.en: A 50 year - old English, died due to fatal hilarity.
sentences.cn: 一名50岁的英国人, 死于致命狂笑.

sentences.en: But the result on the Buckingham Palace balcony was undoubtedly hilarity - to all but the Queen.
sentences.cn: 但如果这发生在白金汉宫的露台上,毫无疑问,会让王室上下当场笑翻,当然女王除外.

sentences.en: By midnight the hilarity had increased.
sentences.cn: 天已经到了午夜时分,人们的狂欢劲仍然有增无减.

sentences.en: Eva joined in the hilarity as much as anyone.
sentences.cn: 伊娃和其他人一样尽情欢笑。

sentences.en: It'seems to me that he grew more erect as the fraternal hilarity increased.
sentences.cn: 我觉得随着沆瀣一气的欢闹的高涨,他也变得越发端庄了.

sentences.en: Radolph's sceptism excited Winterbourne to further hilarity.
sentences.cn: 兰道夫的怀疑主义更使温德朋笑个不停.

sentences.en: Still it makes for a bit of hilarity in the tent every morning.
sentences.cn: 不过,每天早晨穿衣服还是制造了一点小小的欢娱.

sentences.en: The announcement was greeted with much hilarity and mirth.
sentences.cn: 这一项宣布引起了热烈的欢呼声.

sentences.en: The company doubled up with hilarity.
The hilarity at the association's expense burst all bounds, now.
sentences.cn: 拿协会开玩笑, 此时已漫无限度.

sentences.en: The movie, " Trains, Planes, and Automobiles " treats this with hilarity and poignancy.
sentences.cn: 电影 “ 火车, 飞机和汽车 ” 是以欢娱和热情庆祝这个节日.

sentences.en: The square, resounding with the roll and clang of music , presented a scene of noisy hilarity.
sentences.cn: 广场上锣鼓喧天, 场面可热火啦!

sentences.en: Wine gives not light hilarity, but noisy merriment.
sentences.cn: 酒不给人以轻松的欢乐, 而给人以嚣嚷的狂欢.

words.tran_cn: 欢闹的；非常滑稽的；喜不自禁的

trans.tran_en: laughter, or a feeling of fun
